revised_title: Ionophore Effects on Renin Secretion and Renal Vasoconstriction
tldr: The study investigates the effects of ionophores A23187 and R02-2985 on renin secretion and renal vasoconstriction in isolated perfused rat kidneys. The results show that both ionophores cause vasoconstriction and inhibit renin release, with A23187 showing a more significant effect. The effects are calcium-dependent, supporting the link between renin release, renal vasoconstriction, and calcium flux.
